item.title: Report X-2024080015
item.description:
Report X-2024080015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-05T15:15:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: AZTEC
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Based on my experience with tracking limited quantity packages I know that the outer box did not have any labels declaring it was a HAZMAT of any kind Limited Quantity or not based on Hub using a separate scan for NC/IC belt additional care scans which was not used in this case. Not sure if it's relevant, I had to call an associate from Summit Racing in order to get the SDS and he himself said that it was not available outside the company.

item.title: Report E-2024070767
item.description:
Report E-2024070767

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, two (2) 55-pound bags of UN1457 were torn in transit and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Advanced Environmental Services (AES) to remediate the impacted site. AES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
